Item

      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  Boost
      Boost Represents the Boost item and its effect One of the three items that can be used by Player.
      class  Oil
      Oil Represents the Oil item and its effect One of the three items that can be used by Player.
      class  Tomato
      Tomato Represents the Tomato item and its effect One of the three items that can be used by Player.
      Methods in <Unnamed> that return Item 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Item Player.getHeldItem()
      This method is called by the World class so it knows which item, if any, to have displayed in the panel down the bottom right of the screen.

      Method parameters in <Unnamed> with type arguments of type Item 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      abstract boolean Item.applyEffect(Racer racer, java.util.ArrayList<Item> mapItems)
      Specifying that each Item derived from this class must have a useEffect method which can be called when the Item is collided with.
      boolean Tomato.applyEffect(Racer racer, java.util.ArrayList<Item> mapItems)
      This method applies the effect of the item.
      boolean Boost.applyEffect(Racer racer, java.util.ArrayList<Item> mapItems)
      This method applies the effect of the Item to the Racer, namely Player.
      boolean Oil.applyEffect(Racer racer, java.util.ArrayList<Item> mapItems)
      This method applies the effect of the item.
      void Player.checkItemCollision(java.util.ArrayList<Item> mapItems)
      Goes through each item, checking if the Player is within range of it.
      void Enemy.checkItemCollision(java.util.ArrayList<Item> mapItems)
      Goes through each item on the map and confirms that it is active.
      abstract void Racer.checkItemCollision(java.util.ArrayList<Item> mapItems)
      Signals that all subclasses must have this method so they can check if they have collided with any items on the map.
      void Racer.processActiveItems(java.util.ArrayList<Item> mapItems)
      When the very inner if statement is triggered, it means that the useEffect() method of the item in question returned true, indicating that its active effect on the player should end.
      static void Item.renderItems(java.util.ArrayList<Item> mapItems, double camX, double camY)
      Currently this just renders every item in the game world without consideration for if they are actually in the screen frame.
      void Racer.update(double rotateDir, double moveDir, World world, java.util.ArrayList<Item> mapItems, Racer[] racers)
      Updates the angle and speed of the car, as well as processing any
      static void Enemy.updateEnemies(World world, Racer[] racers, Enemy[] enemies, Player player, java.util.ArrayList<Item> mapItems, double[][] waypoints)
      This method is a gateway to the methods that do most of the heavy lifting with the implementation of all the Enemies.
      static void Item.updateItems(java.util.ArrayList<Item> mapItems, World world)
      This method is passed the items on the map from World, as well as world itself.
